alert.note: Alert for Grayson; Smyth; Tazewell (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 8:24PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Watauga, northwestern Ashe, Smyth, Tazewell and southwestern Grayson Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 824 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Glen Burke to 8 miles southeast of Abingdon to 6 miles east of Hampton. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Marion... Richlands... Tazewell... Saltville... Chilhowie... Cedar Bluff... and Ashland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
